full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 125 of 228 801 LC2VMAX4

THE COURT: Sure.
MS. COMEY: Sure.
Q. Between approximately when you first met Ms. Maxwell in 1991 and when you stopped working for Jeffrey Epstein in 2002, where did you understand Ms. Maxwell to be sleeping when she was in Palm Beach?
A. She was sleeping at Mr. Epstein's bedroom.
Q. And was that the master bedroom that we saw on the diagram earlier?
A. Yes.
Q. How many desks did Mr. Epstein have in his home in Palm Beach?
A. In his home he had three desks. One at the right-hand side of his bedroom, one by the lake room in the first floor, and one desk by the pool house, on the south part of the pool house.
Q. How many desks did Ms. Maxwell have at the Palm Beach residence between 1991 and 2002?
A. One.
Q. Where was that?
A. That was in the garden room, close to the pantry.
Q. Over your years working for Mr. Epstein, what, if any, females did you observe coming to his Palm Beach residence?
A. Many, many, many females.
Q. How old did most of them appear to be?

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300

DOJ-OGR-00017998
